accounts.apps module

class accounts.apps.AccountsConfig(app_name, app_module)[source]

Bases: AppConfig

Configuration for the accounts django application and defines the metadata and settings for the ‘accounts’ app, allowing django to access and manage it.

Parameters:

  • default_auto_field – Specifies the default PK field type for the models in this app to BigAutoField

  • name – The python path to this app, used by Django for referencing

default_auto_field = 'django.db.models.BigAutoField'
name = 'accounts'

accounts.forms module

class accounts.forms.SignUpForm(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: UserCreationForm

Form for user registration, extending Django’s built-in UserCreationForm.

This form allows users to create new accounts with additional fields beyond the default username and password, specifically first name, last name, and email. It is designed to work with Django’s custom user model.

Parameters:

  • first_name (str) – User’s first name (CharField).

  • last_name (str) – User’s last name (CharField).

  • email (str) – User’s email address (EmailField).

class Meta[source]

Bases: Meta

Meta options for the SignUpForm.

This inner class defines the associated model and the fields to be displayed and managed by the form.

Parameters:

  • model (class) – The Django model that this form is associated with. It is set to Django’s currently active user model.

  • fields (tuple) – A tuple of field names to be included in the form. It extends the default UserCreationForm fields with ‘first_name’, ‘last_name’, and ‘email’.

fields = ('username', 'first_name', 'last_name', 'email')
model

alias of User

base_fields = {'email': <django.forms.fields.EmailField object>, 'first_name': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'last_name': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'password1': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'password2': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'username': <django.contrib.auth.forms.UsernameField object>}

accounts.views.accounts_index(request: HttpRequest) → HttpRequest[source]

Accesses request object data for the profile page.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

An HTTP response object that will eventually render the profile page.

Return type:

HttpRequest

accounts.views.authenticate_user(request: HttpRequest) → HttpRequest[source]

Authenticates user data submitted via the login page.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object, containing user login data if POST.

Returns:

Redirects to the planner index on successful authentication, otherwise re-renders the login page with errors.

Return type:

HttpRequest

accounts.views.logout_view(request: HttpRequest) → HttpRequest[source]

Handles user logout requests.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Redirects the user to the login page after logging out.

Return type:

HttpRequest

accounts.views.register(request: HttpRequest) → HttpRequest[source]

Handles user registration requests.

Processes the registration form, saves user details, and renders the signup HTML form.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object, containing registration form data if POST.

Returns:

Redirects to the login page on successful registration, otherwise renders the signup form with errors.

Return type:

HttpRequest

accounts.views.show_user(request: HttpRequest) → HttpRequest[source]

Displays details for the logged-in user.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object, containing logged-in user details.

Returns:

Renders HTML with the user’s profile view.

Return type:

HttpRequest

accounts.views.user_login(request: HttpRequest) → HttpRequest[source]

Handles user login requests.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object, containing login data if POST.

Returns:

Renders the login page HTML.

Return type:

HttpRequest
